title: (x) "Sommerferie" sans from apt.no - Hermes {Yves}
content:
anybody?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201154034im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/h2_891181586e1cd3f52dadda68ae16df97_5970.gif)

 [‹ (x) Iron Works logo mediaeval looking serif face - Morpheus (Mason rip-off) {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201154034/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47597 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Nu-Wave Pools logo - Revue {Sebastian, Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201154034/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47591 "Go to next forum topic")
author: slokai

comments.content:
Yes — me. ;^)

This is [Hermes](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201154034/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/hermes/?sample_text=Sommerferie); that quirky ’f’ gives it away.

Ah, okay.  
Someone must have customized it, see the two-storey ‘a’ (completely inappropriate, if you ask me):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201154034im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/a_4146.png)
  
Maybe they did it in order to harmonize the ‘a’ with the ‘æ’. And they might have changed the ‘æ’ in the first place, because that really [is kinda quirky in the original Hermes](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201154034/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/hermes/?sample_text=%C3%A6&sample_size=144). Nothing but presumptions. ;-)
